page.title: 09GRAFTON MANOR, BROMSGROVE
page.content: { Grafton Manor,}just SW of Bromsgrove, dates back to the original{Domesday} {Book.}It is a large house which has been connected with many important events in history -{Cade's Rebellion,} {-Battle of Bosworth}when it became the property of the{Talbot family,}- the {Gunpowder Plot.("Bygone Bromsgrove"} published by the{'Bromsgrove Society'} documents its history well.)From being one of the most important manors in the country, Grafton Manor was sold by the Talbot family in 1934. In 1946 it became a{rest home}for the elderly but in the 1980's much of the house has been restored to former glories by its present owners and is run as a{high} {class restaurant,}(minimum cost of a meal Â£16.75) Grafton has a{large fish} {pond, Elizabethan dovecote,}a superb old {chapel} and {priest house.} The Elizabethan garden is being restored.
